name: web3
title: Web 3
desc: Questions about CRUD operations, HTTP, and Browsers.

question: What does CRUD stand for in web development?
Which HTTP method is typically used for deleting a resource?
What role by the default do browsers play in the HTTP protocol?

options.text: Browsers are responsible for generating HTTP requests
Browsers interpret and display HTTP responses
Browsers establish server connections using HTTP
Browsers authenticate users for HTTP requests

question: In HTTP, what status code indicates a successful request?
Which HTTP method is typically used for retrieving data?
What is the purpose of cookies in web browsing?

options.text: To store session information on the client side
To encrypt data transmitted over HTTP

question: Which HTTP header is commonly used for caching?
What is the purpose of the 'User-Agent' header in HTTP requests?

options.text: To identify the user's IP address
To specify the browser and operating system making the request
To authenticate the user for access control
To specify the language preference of the user

question: What is the purpose of a 'favicon' in web development?

options.text: To indicate the website's primary language
To provide a small icon for the website in browser tabs and bookmarks
To secure user data transmitted over the network

question: Which HTTP method is typically used for updating existing data?
